function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Simplified model assumptions may not be generalizable across all settings","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of factors that can negatively impact the efficacy of vector control, such as insecticide resistance and improper choice of insecticide","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of seasonal fluctuation in mosquito biting habits, leading to inaccurate representations of disease transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Focus on general mosquito bite prevention may overshadow the importance of disease prevention messages","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in outbreak timing across patches","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of personal protection measures without local vector control","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of concern for disease and concern for bites on disease burden","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Individuals reassessing their use of personal protection based on concern for disease and being bitten","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Semi-arbitrary choice of 2 days for length of time in the protected class","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Utilizing the parameter for distribution of susceptible individuals between protected and unprotected classes to adjust initial conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High community-level control","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low community-level control of vector spread","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of personal protection impact on outbreak size","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of personal protection measures","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate community-level vector control","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Sensitivity to parameters with semi-arbitrary values","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on human mobility for the spatial spread of the virus may lead to uncontrolled propagation in densely populated areas with high mobility.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Environmental concern regarding pesticide use can lead to a decrease in demand for mosquito control measures, impacting the control of disease-carrying mosquitoes.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases through human mobility","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited carrying capacity for mosquito larvae in each patch","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mosquito-borne virus transmission through human-mosquito interaction","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assuming 80% efficacy of personal protective measures against mosquitos may lead to underestimation of transmission rates and disease spread.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Individuals continuously assess their protection status based on the adult mosquito population size and the prevalence of infected humans.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aggregate average public demand for local-level vector control by authorities is dictated by the infected human population.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The modified ross-macdonald model reflects the specific case of zika virus in aedes aegypti mosquitos.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulties in implementing and maintaining broad-scale mosquito control programs due to financial and environmental considerations","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on personal protective measures in mosquito control efforts","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations of population-level approach to vector control and lack of consideration for individual-level personal protection","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wider range of suitable habitats for mosquito populations due to climate change","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Expanding urbanization, international travel, trade, and population growth contributing to potential for mosquito-borne disease outbreak","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of capacity for essential vector-control operations in community vector control organizations","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to infectious agents","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High agent exposure times","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in the model-agnostic design may lead to inaccurate risk assessment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of real-world variability in occupant behavior and building characteristics may lead to inaccurate exposure assessments.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate simulation of agent interactions may lead to underestimation of occupant exposure in confined spaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumptions necessary for the calibration of both the underlying crowd model and exposed","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sensitivity of the exposed model to user assumptions for occupant exposure and k-multiplier","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Verification and validation v&v of crowd models","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate representation of human movement in crowd models may lead to underestimation of disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for individual attributes in crowd models can result in higher exposure of vulnerable individuals","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Universal application of exposed to any pedestrian crowd models","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of exposed to simulate people movement during pandemics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Application of exposed in informing building design and minimizing occupant exposure","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Retrofitting existing crowd models may lead to errors in occupant exposure assessments during pandemics.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on assumptions concerning disease transmissions may lead to inaccurate occupant exposure assessments.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Heavy dependence on existing crowd models and assumptions may limit the accuracy and applicability of the occupant exposure assessments.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure time between 0 and 5 minutes for each individual agent to a given number of agents in the building","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Identifying the maximum number of people that agents are exposed to at the same time","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
